Paper 1.stem: Part of the graph of a quadratic function is shown below. The graph passes through the point $A(1,15)$ and it cuts the x-axis at the points B and C. Given that C is (6, 0) and $x=2$ is the line of symmetry of the graph,
Paper 1.diagramDescription: A parabolic curve opening downwards plotted on a Cartesian coordinate system. It peaks above the x-axis, passes through point A(1, 15) on the left side of the peak, intersects the x-axis at B on the left and C(6, 0) on the right. The line of symmetry is marked as the vertical dashed line x = 2.

parts.questionText: write down the equation of the quadratic curve in the form $y=a(x-h)^{2}+k$.
find the positive value of x when $y=4,$ leaving your answer in exact form.

Paper 1.title: Quadratic Graph Properties

Paper 1.stem: In the following graph, write down a possible value of n and the corresponding value of b for the equation $y=x^n+b$.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: A coordinate graph showing a curve passing through the point (1, -1). The curve is in the shape of a cubic or odd power function, starting from bottom left and going to top right.

parts.questionText: Find $n$ and $b$.

Paper 1.title: Graphs of Functions

Paper 1.diagramDescription: Part (a) shows two intersecting lines AB and PQ on a Cartesian plane. Part (b) shows a parabola opening upwards intersecting the x-axis at -4 and 1.5.

parts.questionText: Leanne says that the equation of the line AB is $2y=-4x+1$ and the equation of the line PQ is $4y=-9x+2$. Is she correct? Explain your answer.
The diagram shows the graph of $y=x^{2}+px+q$. (i) Write down equation of the graph in the form $y=x^{2}+px+q$. (ii) Find the coordinates of the minimum point.

Paper 1.title: Coordinate Geometry

Paper 1.stem: The diagrams show the speed-time graph and the corresponding distance-time graph of a car. The car travelled from a point P to Q and in the journey, its greatest speed attained was 1.5 km/min.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Two graphs. First is speed-time with speed reaching 1.5 km/min. Second is distance-time showing total distance 92.25 km. Times 0800, 0820, 0900 and T are marked.

parts.questionText: Convert $1.5~km/min$ to m/s.
Show that v, the initial speed, was $0.6~km/min$
Find the speed of the car, in $m/s,$ at 0812.
The total distance travelled by the car is 92.25 km. Find the time, T, when it comes to a complete stop.

Paper 1.title: Kinematics

Paper 1.stem: From the diagrams below, select one of them which best illustrates each of the following statements.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Five sketch graphs labelled Diagram 1 to Diagram 5. Diagram 1 is a straight line y=c. Diagram 2 is a straight line passing through origin. Diagram 3 is a straight line with positive y-intercept. Diagram 4 is an increasing curve starting from origin (like x^2 or x^3). Diagram 5 is a decreasing curve (inverse proportion).

parts.questionText: The cost of a project $y$ is a linear function of $x$, where $x$ is the number of man-hours required to complete the project. The project has a fixed cost of $100.
An object is travelling at a constant speed towards a fixed point O. The distance $y$ (in metres) represents how far the object is from point O at time $x$ (in minutes).

Paper 1.title: Matching Graphs to Situations

Paper 1.stem: A vaccine was introduced to a virus in an experiment. The number, N, of virus t hours after being introduced to the vaccine is given by $N=v\times0.9^{2t}$ where v is the amount of vaccine introduced.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Four diagrams showing shapes of N against t. Diagram 1: Decreasing curve convex. Diagram 2: Linear decreasing. Diagram 3: Increasing curve. Diagram 4: Increasing linear.

parts.questionText: After 1 hour, the number of virus has decreased to 81 000. Find v.
Find in terms of $k$, the number of virus when $0.81^{t}=k$.
Find the decrease in the number of virus after 2 hours as a percentage of the number of virus at the beginning.
Which of these diagrams represent the graph of N against t?

Paper 1.title: Exponential Decay Function

Paper 1.stem: The graphs of $y=\frac{x^{3}}{2}-4x-1$ and $y=1-x$ are drawn on the grid.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: A graph showing a cubic curve and a straight line intersecting at three points. The x-axis ranges from -4 to 5, y-axis from -5 to 4.

parts.questionText: The points of intersection of the curve and the straight line give the solutions of a cubic equation. Find the cubic equation, giving your answer in the form $ax^{3}+bx^{2}+cx+d=0$, where a, b, c and d are integers.
By drawing a tangent, find the gradient of the curve at (-2,3).
The equation $x^{3}-4x=0$ can be solved by drawing a suitable straight line on the grid. Find the equation of the straight line.
By drawing this straight line, solve the equation $x^{3}-4x=0$.

Paper 1.title: Graphical Solutions
